comments:
1. In a new workspace, with no server runtimes defined, create a simple Java project using File > New, Other, Java, Java project.
2. Launch the Web service client wizard. 
   Page 1: Click Next.
   Page 2: Enter a WSDL URL, click Next.
   Page 3: Notice that the EAR field is enabled. It should be disabled for Java projects.
If you continue through the wizard and click Finish, an EAR project will get created and an attempt will be made to add the Java project to the EAR and the following Exception will occur:

Chris,

This is a regression and it should be a fairly easy, low risk fix. Can we consider this one for 1.5?

Thanks.
Rupam, yes, there is room in M5 for [low risk] fixes.

patch 1 of 2

patch 2 of 2
The attached patches are ready to be committed.

Thanks Rupam,
reviewed but not committed yet. Got a few questions, the last two of which don't relate directly to your fix:

1. handleProjectChanged() may result in updateEARState getting called twice, a method that can potentially do alot. I haven't analyzed deeply whether the possible second call may degenerate to nothing. If so, no worries I guess.

2. I don't understand why part 3 of projectNeedsEAR() - the chunk of code unscathed by your fix - homing in on J2EE 1.3 runtimes.

3. There's a fair bit of commented out code in ProjectSelectionWidget. Are we keeping it around for some reason, or can we toast it?

Thanks - CB.

Regarding 1, yes, when handleProjectChanged() is called as the result of user actions, updateEARState() will get called twice and the second call will repeat what the first call did. We could remove the call to updateEARState() from handleProjectChanged() but we'd have to do some checking and testing to make sure this didn't adversely affect places where handleProjectChanged() is called with the listeners turned off (i.e. refreshProjectItems and setProjectName), since, in these cases, updateEARState would not get called at all.

Regarding 2, I think we could remove the version and pass in null. ServerUtil.getRuntimes javadoc seems to say it will match all versions if we pass in null.

Regarding 3, the comments can be deleted ( just my pack-rat tendencies again!)

Created an attachment (id=35317)
apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.runtime.ProjectSelectionWidget

Attaching updated patch for ProjectSelectionWidget. To summarize the change respecting calls to updateEARState():

Before (prior to any of the attached patches):
When handleProjectChanged was called with listeners on or off, we called updateTemplates() and updateEARState()

Now:
When handleProjectChanged is called with listeners off, we call updateTemplates and updateEARState

When handleProjectChanged is called with listeners on, we call updateTemplates which results in an event that calls updateEARState()

The difference between before and now is that updateTemplates will only result in an event if the selected project in non-empty - so whereas before we would call updateEARState() even if the selected project was empty, now we don't. I don't think this is an issue.

BTW - updateEARState need no be as expensive as it is now. I've opened bug 129369.

I also removed all the dead comments in the code.
Thanks much, Rupam. Changes committed. Will release later.

I looked at the patches and they involve some changes to the UI event handling on page 3 of the wizard. I really would prefer to not be touching this code so late in 1.0.2, especially since the Web serivce client code gets generated into the Java project successfully before the Exception occurs.
